column5: 44lb... it looks like it will end up on that wall.

quote from the article: “it was the biggest brown trout I have ever seen.” um considering it is a world record...no kidding Ridiculous fish. I am sure what sounds to be a very busy fishery will now be busier
I didn't think triploid fish farm escapees were eligible for records, wasn't a Bow caught and disqualified a few years back ?
didn't want to give away location, but there are three canals. um, so that certainly keeps it secret lol
I think the official world record bow from lake Diefenbacker is a triploid.  	However, I haven't seen any evidence that this brown is a triploid.
Sure looks like a hatchery fish to me.  Just one persons opinion however.   Reminds me of the mutant rainbows I catch around Parry Sound.
Either way, whether this brown is triploid or not, I don't agree with Frankenfish being eligible for records.
Maybe, but hatchery fish doesn't mean that it's a triploid.
What ever it is,I would be more then happy to tour the fishing world to show it off.
It would have been fun catching that from your pontoon boat.
I am still waiting to hook into a  good king off Thornbury to take me for a tour.
Nope you're right it doesn't.   Just looking at it screams triploid to me.   Similar to what the Konrad boys pull out of Diefenbaker.
No doubt.  And they eat anything.
